column3: Is there any reason to not always be in line buffering?\n

Now that you mention it, unconditional line buffering is even better because it makes `tail -f debug.log` work. And debug.log resides in the data directory anyway, where frequent writes are to be expected.

I've updated the commit.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/283e405c063acfca304acbff505badcbbcb814c9 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

As for buffering when writing to debug.log, we don't do any buffering at all there so `tail -f` already works!

See
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util.cpp#L233
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util.cpp#L289
